## Resources in this talk 

- [{emo}](https://github.com/hadley/emo) package (by Hadley Wickham): add emoji in R Markdown
- [Danielle Navarro](https://djnavarro.net/) - great teacher, artist, packages for generative art in R! 
- [A Fresh Look at Introductory Data Science](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/10691898.2020.1804497) by Mine Cetinkaya-Rundel and Victoria Ellison
- The [{palmerpenguins}](https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/) R package
- More [photos of the Palmer Archipelago penguins](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1DFJLXYRJ2kWw6AFkJu7MclFPr8zkqD-PHh5bs4xcr3Y/edit)
- [{swirl}](https://swirlstats.com/) package to "learn R, in R" with existing lessons, or you can modify / create your own lessons! 
- [Data science in a box](https://datasciencebox.org/index.html) by Mine Cetinkaya-Rundel
- [The big book of R](https://www.bigbookofr.com/) by Oscar Baruffa
- [R for Excel Users](https://rstudio-conf-2020.github.io/r-for-excel/) 2-day workshop by Lowndes & Horst
- [{learnr}](https://rstudio.github.io/learnr/) for interactive lessons without installation
- [RStudio Cloud](https://rstudio.cloud/)
